display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 480px; margin-left: 225px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Key Term Concepts:
1. Binary Search Tree
2. Left child node & Right child node
3. a Valid BST
4. BST Property: imposes the condition that, for each node, its Left descendents are less than or equal to the current node, which is less than the right descendents.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 98px; height: 1px; padding-top: 85px; margin-left: 334px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 183px; height: 1px; padding-top: 465px; margin-left: 610px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Binary Tree Traversal
we know: this is
Pre-Order Traversal: visits the current node before its child nodes

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 178px; height: 1px; padding-top: 460px; margin-left: 815px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
- In-Order Traversal: visit the Left Branch, then the current branch, finally the right branch
- Post-Order Traversal: visits the current node after its child nodes

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 182px; height: 1px; padding-top: 640px; margin-left: 231px;

div.div:
Not a Binary Search Tree
example below:

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Definition:
A Binary Tree: is a tree in which each node has up to TWO children. Not all trees are binary tree.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 313px; height: 1px; padding-top: 630px; margin-left: 610px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Definition:
A Binary Search Tree: is a binary tree in which every node fits a specific ordering property:
all Left descendents <= n < all right descendents.
This must be TRUE for each node

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 10px; margin-left: 203px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: step#1: Init a variable named ClosestValue: which will hold best number which is closest to the TargetValue

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 119px; height: 1px; padding-top: 316px; margin-left: 4px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Step#2: Compare the currentNode that we are at to the TargetValue
HOW?to compare
1)compute the Absolute Difference
between currentValue and targetValue
2) e.g. |10-12| = 2
==> 2 ?? Infinite
is 2 <= |closestNode-targetNode| =
|Infinite - 12| = Inifinite

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 550px; margin-left: 4px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
3) Is 'Infinite' < 2 ??==> No
4)
|MAX| closer to 12
OR
|10-12| closer to 12
==> Decison Making
10
So, update the closestValue = 10

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 140px; margin-left: 164px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 195px; margin-left: 139px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 245px; margin-left: 134px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 765px; margin-left: 4px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Since we are at BST: so every number of the left of currentNode = 10 is smaller than 10
e.g. is 5 closer to 12
OR
is 15 closer to 12
==> 15
and 12 is greater than 10, so you wanna find a number at least greater than 10

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 177px; height: 1px; padding-top: 182px; margin-left: 815px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Step#4:
now, we are looking at currentNode = 15
|currentVal - targetVal|
e.g. |15-12| = 3
compare with the previous record
|10- 12| = 2
that means 15 is farther away from 12 than 10 by (value 1)
===> so, we do NOT update currentValue
2)
since 15 > 12 which means every num greater than 15, would be even more far away from 12
==> so eliminate '22'
so currentValue = 13
compute: |13-12| = 1
with previous best record:
|10-12| = 2
is 1 better than 2, YES, so we found the ClosestValue =13
